intro: Doratoxylon, commonly known as the golden saxifrage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to arid and rocky environments, it is well adapted to survive in dry conditions. The plant typically grows in crevices or on slopes, thriving in regions with limited water availability. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a notable species in its ecological niche.
